Projects

A growing collection of the cool projects.

CrossSeizure: Learning Generalizable Representations for Cross-Dataset Epileptic Seizure Classification

Zhenan Yin and Saptarshi Purkayastha

A deep learning study that develops a CNN–Transformer hybrid framework to achieve cross-dataset generalization in epileptic seizure classification using minimally preprocessed raw EEG signals from multiple datasets.

Embeddings are Noise Eliminators: Ablation Studies to Show What is Eliminated in Foundation Models

Raajitha Muthyala, Zhenan Yin, Alekhya Jilla, Frank Li, Theo Dapamede, Bardia Khosravi, Mohammadreza Chavoshi, Judy Gichoya, and Saptarshi Purkayastha

An exploratory study examining how foundation model embeddings inherently eliminate non-clinical noise and imaging artifacts through systematic ablation experiments, revealing their role as intrinsic noise filters in medical image representation.

Submitted to Radiology - Artificial Intelligence (Technical Developments)

The Connection Between Mycobacterium Tuberculosis and Macrophage Cells in Lung Cancer Progression

Zhenan Yin, advised by Dr. Bridget Bannerman & Prof. Jorge Júlvez

An exploratory study for investigating how Mycobacterium tuberculosis influences macrophage metabolism and contributes to lung cancer development through genome-scale metabolic modeling.

Triton Town Autonomous Vehicles

Zhenan Yin, advised by Prof. Maurício de Oliveira & Prof. Jack Silberman

An engineering study for developing a deep learning-driven autonomous vehicle capable of real-time navigation and object detection through integrated hardware design and computer vision algorithms.

Conformal Ultrasonic Device for Non-Invasive Central Blood Pressure Monitoring

Chonghe Wang, Xiaoshi Li, Hongjie Hu, Lin Zhang, Zhenlong Huang, Muyang Lin, Zhuorui Zhang, Zhenan Yin, Brady Huang, Hua Gong, Shubha Bhaskaran, Yue Gu, Mitsutoshi Makihata, Yuxuan Guo, Yusheng Lei, Yimu Chen, Chunfeng Wang, Yang Li, Tianjiao Zhang, Zeyu Chen, Albert P. Pisano, Liangfang Zhang, Qifa Zhou, and Sheng Xu

An engineering study focused on developing a conformal ultrasonic device using stretchable circuit patterning for non-invasive monitoring of central blood pressure and deep-tissue hemodynamics.

Nature Biomedical Engineering, 2018

Paper

Deep Learning for Plankton Image Retrieval

Zhenan Yin, Devon Stanfield, and Nuno Vasconcelos

A computational study for developing a deep learning-based system that automates plankton image labeling and retrieval to support oceanographic research on marine ecosystem analysis.
